pattern_2.paper_title: Large time stabilization of rough-data solutions in one-dimensional nonlinear thermoelasticity
pattern_2.description:
In an open bounded real interval $Ω$, the model for one-dimensional thermoelasticity given by \[
  u_{tt} = u_{xx} - \big(f(Θ)\big)_x,
  \qquad
  Θ_t = Θ_{xx} - f(Θ) u_{xt}, \] is considered along with homogeneous boundary conditions of Dirichlet type for $u$ and of Neumann type for $Θ$, under the assumption that $f\in C^1([0,\infty))$ satisfies $f(0)=0$, $f'\in L^\infty((0,\infty))$ and $f'>0$ on $[0,\infty)$
pattern_2.description_original:
In an open bounded real interval $Ω$, the model for one-dimensional thermoelasticity given by \[
  u_{tt} = u_{xx} - \big(f(Θ)\big)_x,
  \qquad
  Θ_t = Θ_{xx} - f(Θ) u_{xt}, \] is considered along with homogeneous boundary conditions of Dirichlet type for $u$ and of Neumann type for $Θ$, under the assumption that $f\in C^1([0,\infty))$ satisfies $f(0)=0$, $f'\in L^\infty((0,\infty))$ and $f'>0$ on $[0,\infty)$

pattern_1.paper_title: MambaVF: State Space Model for Efficient Video Fusion
pattern_1.description: First, by reformulating video fusion as a sequential state update process, MambaVF captures long-range temporal dependencies with linear complexity while significantly reducing computation and memory costs

pattern_1.paper_title: Entanglement improves coordination in distributed systems

pattern_2.paper_title: Dynamics of a nonlocal epidemic model with a new free boundary condition, part 1: Spreading-vanishing dichotomy
pattern_2.description: This paper investigates the long-time dynamics of a nonlocal epidemic model with free boundaries, where a pathogen with density $u(t,x)$ and the infected humans with density $v(t,x)$ evolve according to a reaction-diffusion system with nonlocal diffusion over a one dimensional interval $[g(t), h(t)]$, which represents the epidemic region expanding through its boundaries $x=g(t)$ and $x=h(t)$, known as free boundaries
pattern_2.description_original: This paper investigates the long-time dynamics of a nonlocal epidemic model with free boundaries, where a pathogen with density $u(t,x)$ and the infected humans with density $v(t,x)$ evolve according to a reaction-diffusion system with nonlocal diffusion over a one dimensional interval $[g(t), h(t)]$, which represents the epidemic region expanding through its boundaries $x=g(t)$ and $x=h(t)$, known as free boundaries

pattern_1.paper_title: Optimal scaling laws in learning hierarchical multi-index models
pattern_1.description: In this work, we provide a sharp theory of scaling laws for two-layer neural networks trained on a class of hierarchical multi-index targets, in a genuinely representation-limited regime
pattern_1.description_original: In this work, we provide a sharp theory of scaling laws for two-layer neural networks trained on a class of hierarchical multi-index targets, in a genuinely representation-limited regime

pattern_2.paper_title: Enabling Large-Scale Channel Sounding for 6G: A Framework for Sparse Sampling and Multipath Component Extraction

pattern_2.paper_title: Explicit List-Decodable Linearized Reed-Solomon Subspace Codes via Subspace Designs
pattern_2.description: Our codes are subcodes of LRS codes, obtained by restricting message polynomials to an $\mathbb{F}_h$-subspace derived from subspace designs, and the decoding list size is bounded by $h^{\mathrm{poly}(1/\varepsilon)}$

pattern_2.paper_title: Covariant Helmholtz-Hodge Decomposition: Resolving Spurious Vorticity via Acoustic Geometry
pattern_2.description: For canonical entropy-spot refraction and normal-shock discontinuities, Euclidean Helmholtz--Hodge and momentum-potential post-processing produce significant leakage in the refracting/discontinuous region, whereas the covariant splitting remains at the numerical noise floor (typically $\lesssim 10^{-12}$) throughout the domain, demonstrating robustness even at the sonic horizon, where the Euclidean metric singularity typically causes catastrophic error amplification
pattern_2.description_original: For canonical entropy-spot refraction and normal-shock discontinuities, Euclidean Helmholtz--Hodge and momentum-potential post-processing produce significant leakage in the refracting/discontinuous region, whereas the covariant splitting remains at the numerical noise floor (typically $\lesssim 10^{-12}$) throughout the domain, demonstrating robustness even at the sonic horizon, where the Euclidean metric singularity typically causes catastrophic error amplification

pattern_1.paper_title: Selecting Hyperparameters for Tree-Boosting
pattern_1.description: In this article, we empirically compare several popular methods for hyperparameter optimization for tree-boosting including random grid search, the tree-structured Parzen estimator (TPE), Gaussian-process-based Bayesian optimization (GP-BO), Hyperband, the sequential model-based algorithm configuration (SMAC) method, and deterministic full grid search using $59$ regression and classification data sets
pattern_1.description_original: In this article, we empirically compare several popular methods for hyperparameter optimization for tree-boosting including random grid search, the tree-structured Parzen estimator (TPE), Gaussian-process-based Bayesian optimization (GP-BO), Hyperband, the sequential model-based algorithm configuration (SMAC) method, and deterministic full grid search using $59$ regression and classification data sets

pattern_1.paper_title: On the stability of viscous Riemann ellipsoids
pattern_1.description: In the inviscid regime, we derive a generalised Poincare equation governing small fluid oscillations and construct a family of polynomial solutions that extends the classical results of Cartan to flows with a uniform strain field
pattern_1.description_original: In the inviscid regime, we derive a generalised Poincare equation governing small fluid oscillations and construct a family of polynomial solutions that extends the classical results of Cartan to flows with a uniform strain field

pattern_2.paper_title: The Stretto Execution Engine for LLM-Augmented Data Systems

pattern_1.paper_title: The quenched structured coalescent for diploid population models on finite graphs with large migrations and uneven offspring distributions
pattern_1.description: We show convergence, with mild conditions on the joint distribution of offspring frequencies and migrations, of gene genealogies conditional on the pedigree to a time-inhomogeneous coalescent process driven by a Poisson point process $Ψ$ that records the timing and scale of large migrations and uneven offspring distributions
pattern_1.description_original: We show convergence, with mild conditions on the joint distribution of offspring frequencies and migrations, of gene genealogies conditional on the pedigree to a time-inhomogeneous coalescent process driven by a Poisson point process $Ψ$ that records the timing and scale of large migrations and uneven offspring distributions

pattern_2.paper_title: Acoustic scattering by fractal inhomogeneities via geometry-conforming Galerkin methods for the Lippmann-Schwinger equation
pattern_2.description: We prove convergence estimates for the integral equation solution and superconvergence estimates for linear functionals such as scattered field and far-field pattern evaluations, and elucidate how the regularity of the inhomogeneity boundary and the regularity of the refractive index affect the rates of convergence predicted

pattern_1.paper_title: Joint Embedding Variational Bayes

pattern_2.paper_title: Discrete Aware Tensor Completion via Convexized $\ell_0$-Norm Approximation
pattern_2.description: The proposed low-rank tensor completion (TC) method builds on the conventional nuclear norm (NN) minimization-based low-rank TC paradigm, through the addition of a discrete-aware regularizer, which enforces discreteness in the objective of the problem, by an $\ell_0$-norm regularizer that is approximated by a continuous and differentiable function normalized via fractional programming (FP) under a proximal gradient (PG) framework, in order to solve the proposed problem
pattern_2.description_original: The proposed low-rank tensor completion (TC) method builds on the conventional nuclear norm (NN) minimization-based low-rank TC paradigm, through the addition of a discrete-aware regularizer, which enforces discreteness in the objective of the problem, by an $\ell_0$-norm regularizer that is approximated by a continuous and differentiable function normalized via fractional programming (FP) under a proximal gradient (PG) framework, in order to solve the proposed problem

pattern_1.paper_title: The near-continuum mechanism for extended Boltzmann theory: the non-equilibrium relaxation
pattern_1.description: In this work, the Pullin equation, which possesses an integrable collision kernel and satisfies the detailed balance constraint, is adopted as an extended Boltzmann equation for the theoretical analysis of near-continuum relaxation mechanisms

pattern_2.paper_title: Locally Gentle State Certification for High Dimensional Quantum Systems
pattern_2.description: In this work, we investigate the fundamental limits of \emph{locally-gentle} quantum state certification, where the learning algorithm is constrained to perturb the state by at most $α$ in trace norm, thereby allowing for the reuse of samples

pattern_2.paper_title: Strong local nondeterminism for stochastic time-fractional slow and fast diffusion equations
pattern_2.description: Under the Dalang-type conditions, we prove sharp variance bounds for temporal and spatial increments, as well as strong local nondeterminism in time in several regimes (two-sided version for $β=1$ and for parts of the case $β=2$; one-sided version for $0<β<2$) and strong local nondeterminism in space for the whole range of parameters

pattern_1.paper_title: Radon--Wasserstein Gradient Flows for Interacting-Particle Sampling in High Dimensions

pattern_1.paper_title: A Three-State Thermodynamically Consistent Cross-Bridge Model for Muscle Contraction
pattern_1.description: Under chemostatted conditions and a fast-equilibration closure for the attached substates, the model reduces to a closed two-state molecular motor description; in a further singular limit, this reduction recovers a Huxley-type transport-reaction equation

pattern_2.paper_title: FlowClass.jl: Classifying Dynamical Systems by Structural Properties in Julia
pattern_2.description: Given a vector field \(\mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x})\) defining the system \(\mathrm{d}\mathbf{x}/\mathrm{d}t = \mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x})\), the package performs a battery of computational tests -- Jacobian symmetry analysis, curl magnitude estimation, fixed point detection and stability classification, periodic orbit detection, and stable/unstable manifold computation -- to determine where the system sits within the classification hierarchy
pattern_2.description_original: Given a vector field \(\mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x})\) defining the system \(\mathrm{d}\mathbf{x}/\mathrm{d}t = \mathbf{F}(\mathbf{x})\), the package performs a battery of computational tests -- Jacobian symmetry analysis, curl magnitude estimation, fixed point detection and stability classification, periodic orbit detection, and stable/unstable manifold computation -- to determine where the system sits within the classification hierarchy

pattern_1.paper_title: Lipschitz regularity of harmonic quasiconformal maps between Lyapunov domains in $\mathbb{R}^n$
pattern_1.description: We prove that every sense-preserving harmonic $K$--quasiconformal homeomorphism $f\colon D\toΩ$ between Lyapunov domains (equivalently, bounded $C^{1,α}$ domains) in $\mathbb{R}^n$, $α\in(0,1]$, is globally Lipschitz on $\overline D$

pattern_2.paper_title: Explicit List-Decodable Linearized Reed-Solomon Subspace Codes via Subspace Designs
pattern_2.description: Our codes are subcodes of LRS codes, obtained by restricting message polynomials to an $\mathbb{F}_h$-subspace derived from subspace designs, and the decoding list size is bounded by $h^{\mathrm{poly}(1/\varepsilon)}$
pattern_2.description_original: Our codes are subcodes of LRS codes, obtained by restricting message polynomials to an $\mathbb{F}_h$-subspace derived from subspace designs, and the decoding list size is bounded by $h^{\mathrm{poly}(1/\varepsilon)}$

pattern_2.paper_title: Entanglement improves coordination in distributed systems

pattern_2.description_original: We prove this advantage through queueing-theoretic analysis, non-local game formulation, and computational certification of classical bounds

pattern_1.paper_title: Matrices of nonnegative integer rank two
pattern_1.description: We show that any rank 2 integer matrix can be reduced to a $3\times 3$ matrix which has nonnegative integer rank $2$ if and only if the original one also has nonnegative integer rank $2$, with the reduction computable in polynomial time

pattern_2.paper_title: On the stability of viscous Riemann ellipsoids

pattern_2.description_original: In the inviscid regime, we derive a generalised Poincare equation governing small fluid oscillations and construct a family of polynomial solutions that extends the classical results of Cartan to flows with a uniform strain field

pattern_1.paper_title: Functional Stochastic Localization

pattern_2.paper_title: Navier-Stokes-driven analysis of mean and fluctuating wall shear stress in turbulent channel flow
pattern_2.description: Starting from the streamwise momentum equation, we derive exact integral equations that relate the square plane-average and the square fluctuating WSS to wall-normal integrals of terms combining shear with acceleration, shear with pressure-radient, and shear with viscous diffusion

pattern_1.paper_title: The quenched structured coalescent for diploid population models on finite graphs with large migrations and uneven offspring distributions
pattern_1.description: We show convergence, with mild conditions on the joint distribution of offspring frequencies and migrations, of gene genealogies conditional on the pedigree to a time-inhomogeneous coalescent process driven by a Poisson point process $Ψ$ that records the timing and scale of large migrations and uneven offspring distributions

pattern_2.paper_title: Quantum noise scaling in continuously operating multiparameter sensors
pattern_2.description: We observe linear, quadratic, and cubic scaling of the respective total noise powers with probe photon flux, together with a quadratic dependence of back-action on pump photon flux, in quantitative agreement with a stochastic Bloch-equation model
pattern_2.description_original: We observe linear, quadratic, and cubic scaling of the respective total noise powers with probe photon flux, together with a quadratic dependence of back-action on pump photon flux, in quantitative agreement with a stochastic Bloch-equation model

pattern_1.paper_title: The resurgence of errors in the localization of $\mathcal{N} = 2$ superconformal Yang-Mills

pattern_1.paper_title: Rational Interpreters for Discrete Dynamics: Existence, Exactness, and Decomposition over $p$-adic Fields
pattern_1.description: We address an inverse problem in non-Archimedean dynamics: given a finite discrete dynamical system (equivalently, a functional graph on $N$ states), construct a continuous $p$-adic dynamical system whose residue-level behavior reproduces the prescribed transitions

pattern_1.paper_title: Phase transitions on periodic orbits in $β$-transformation with a hole at zero
pattern_1.description:
For $m\in\mathbb N$ let
  \[
  τ_m(β):=\sup\left\{t\in[0,1): K_β(t)\textrm{ {contains a periodic orbit} of smallest period }m \right\},
  \]
  where $K_β(t)=\{x\in[0,1): T_β^n(x)\notin(0,t)~\forall n\ge 0\}$ is the survivor set of the open dynamical system $(T_β, [0,1), H)$ with a hole $H=(0,t)$

pattern_2.paper_title: Exact coherent structures as building blocks of turbulence on large domains
pattern_2.description: Here, we extend this dynamical systems approach to spatially extended turbulent flows featuring multiple interacting 'substructures', and show how new simple invariant solutions can be constructed by spatial tiling of exact solutions from small-box calculations

pattern_1.paper_title: Pattern Formation in Excitable Neuronal Maps
pattern_1.description: For ring-type patterns, the persistence decays more slowly than exponentially, often following a power law or stretched exponential

pattern_2.paper_title: Superposition unifies power-law training dynamics
pattern_2.description: Our finding that superposition leads to rapid training with a data-independent power law exponent may have important implications for a wide range of neural networks that employ superposition, including production-scale large language models

pattern_1.paper_title: How seed banks evolve in plants: a stochastic dynamical system subject to a strong drift
